publicationStmt.p: Digital edition hosted on http://rickandmorty.newtfire.org and GitHub: https://github.com/dorothealint/Rick-and-Morty

encodingDesc.p: Some small changes to the original transcriptions were made including fixed spelling errors and adding names and scene cuts.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Morty, hurry!

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Return the Truth Tortoise!

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Morty, whatever you do, don’t drop the Truth Tortoise! Also really important, whatever you do, don’t look into its eyes!

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : I I did look at it, Rick! I’ve been looking at it!

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Now you’re gonna know everything, Morty! Good job! Way to go! You [BLEEP] everything up!

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : It’s in my head! Ah! Oh, geez, I I can’t get that Truth Tortoise out of my head.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Yeah, I told you not to look into its eyes. [Smith family living room]Hey, Morty, let’s watch some interdimensional cable. Remember how we used to do that?

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Rick, I can’t I can’t go on. I-I can’t go on like this with the Truth Tortoise shit in my head. I-I wish you could just

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Erase the memory from your mind?

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : How did you know I was gonna say that?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Come on, Morty, come with me.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : After you.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : What the hell is this?!

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : This, Morty, is my archive of all the experiences you’ve begged me to remove from your life, lest you go insane. I call them Morty’s Mind Blowers. And we’ll be doing this instead of interdimensional cable.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : How long have I been asking you to remove memories?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Since the first time your mind was blown. Ahh, here it is. Classic. There’s no dust on it because this isn’t the first time we’ve done this.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : - What?! -

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : I call this one "Moonspiracy"!

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Huh, wow. That’s incredible. What the heck?

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : Morty, do you realize how ridiculous that sounds?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Yeah, pretty crazy story, Morty.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Are you serious? Half the crap we’ve seen, and you think that sounds crazy?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : I’ve been to 300 versions of Earth’s moon, including this one, and I’ve never seen signs of a "regular dude," as you describe him, hanging out up there.

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : It’s probably just a smudge on the lens.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Smudge on the lens? Smudge on the lens?! I know the difference between a man threatening me and a smudge on the goddamn lens, Summer!

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : Morty, calm down! Are you feeling okay?

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : I’m fine!

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : So sensitive.

sp.speaker: Principal
sp.p: : Kids, I’d like to introduce you all to our new guidance counselor, Mr. Lunas.

sp.speaker: Mr. Lunas
sp.p: : I look forward to helping guide you all towards a brighter future. I believe every student should shoot for the moon.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Got you now, you son of a bitch.

sp.speaker: Principal
sp.p: : What’s this?

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Proof that Mr. Lunas isn’t who he says he is! He’s not a guidance counselor? I I assume he’s qualified to be one, who isn’t? But he also lives on the moon.

sp.speaker: Principal
sp.p: : Okay. Hmm. Is that it? Is he doing anything to hurt anyone?

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Oh, he’s up to something.

sp.speaker: Principal
sp.p: : I think I understand. "Up to something," "lives on the moon. " Okay, I’ll talk to him.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : What did he say?

sp.speaker: Principal
sp.p: : Denied the moon stuff, but that’s what pedophiles do, they deny, it’s their bread and butter.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Pedophile?

sp.speaker: Principal
sp.p: : You don’t think so? I thought the moon thing might have been code.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : No, he’s literally from the moon!

sp.speaker: Principal
sp.p: : Well, you saw him react. Moon or not, that dude likes ‘em young.

sp.speaker: Marine
sp.p: : Gordon Lunas was a good Marine. We don’t know what drove him to take his own life, but we want to remember the good things. Like how, from a certain angle, some people would say he looked like a smudge.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Oh, my God, what have I done? What have I done? Jesus, I made that guy kill himself!

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Only in a literal sense. Here’s one I call "Morty’s Menagerie. " They don’t all have titles, though. It’s not a "Simpsons" Halloween special, more like a clip show made of clips you never saw! I can’t believe we got put into a menagerie.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : So this guy collects living beings?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Yeah, you know like commemorative plates, but less off-putting. You’ll get it when you’re still actively dating in your 40s. Assess this with cold indifference, you beany-headed prick! Hey, keep it down! Just our luck, menagerie beneath the "boulder people" of Granitor Seven.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : I can’t take it anymore, Rick!

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Relax, Morty!

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : I can’t relax! R-R-Rick, we We gotta get outta here! I don’t care what it takes! Anything! -

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Anything? -

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Anything!

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : All right, well, you’re gonna have to take off your shirt. Not yet. I’ll tell you when.

sp.speaker: Lady Scientist
sp.p: : Dear God.

sp.speaker: Dude Scientist
sp.p: : What?

sp.speaker: Lady Scientist
sp.p: : The signal turned out to be There’s no other way to put it Instructions.

sp.speaker: Official
sp.p: : For?

sp.speaker: Lady Scientist
sp.p: : A vehicle, sir, an interstellar vehicle.

sp.speaker: Official
sp.p: : We’ll need a pilot. I wonder if there’s a volunteer. Mm.

sp.speaker: Lady Scientist
sp.p: : Oh, the schematics specify a second, smaller pilot. I mean, they really specify smaller. They have to be exactly 5’3".

sp.speaker: Official
sp.p: : Chang, you may have majored in Liberal Arts, but I think you’re about to make history.

sp.speaker: Lady Scientist
sp.p: : Primary systems, check. Auxiliary systems, check. See you soon.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Okay, now.

sp.speaker: A whole bunch of people I don't know
sp.p: Greetings. You’re You look We’ve possessed forms your mind can accept. Here are some customary clothing gifts. Please, put them on. - May we? - Of course, yes. We followed your instructions. We have so much to learn from you. I know, right?

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Hey, how come I was able to see those other people’s memories? I I wouldn’t have been around for that.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Yeah, sometimes I gotta do a little editing, Morty. It helps the mind blowers play a little bit better upon revisiting. I call this one "The Whole Enchilada. " Here, Morty, this’ll make your urine drinkable.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Now can we keep shopping?

sp.speaker: Zikzak
sp.p: : I am Zikzak.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Ah, shit, Morty, get behind me. It’s a [BLEEP] alien overlord! It’s okay. Here. Oh, I misjudged.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : [reads]"I am Floop Floopian. Please kill me."

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : That’s right, Morty. The Floop Floopians achieve an eternal orgasmic afterlife, so long as they’re killed by a great warrior. I’m flattered, by the way. Thank you very much.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : So you’re gonna kill him?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Eh, let’s get some lunch first. So, you want to get shot in the head, or

sp.speaker: Zikzak
sp.p: : Well, as long as the wound is fatal, I don’t really mind where you shoot me.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Cool. I’m gonna go take a quick shit.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Well, I gotta say. You know, I’m a little envious. Your species has an actual afterlife. That’s gotta be nice.

sp.speaker: Zikzak
sp.p: : Wh-What do you mean?

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Well, you know, here on Earth, w-we don’t know what’s going on. It must be nice for you guys to, you know, have that Have that proof’s in the pudding, you know, evidence.

sp.speaker: Zikzak
sp.p: : Evidence? There’s supposed to be evidence?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Um, yeah, uh otherwise, how do you know if it’s true? Wait, you don’t

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : All right, so you want to do this here or outside?

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Run!

sp.speaker: Zikzak
sp.p: : I don’t wanna die! Oh, God, it’s all real! Oh, it hurts! Oh, I shouldn’t have doubted it! I shouldn’t have let you make me doubt it! Aah! I blame you, I blame you!

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : But he said there wasn’t any evidence!

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : That was a ton of evidence! Well, silver lining. Now I know their religion’s real. They have a hell, and it does not look good. I noticed you never finished your chimichanga, so I got some room for it now, if you know what I mean.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Holy [BLEEP]! How many of these are just horrible mistakes I’ve made? I mean, maybe I’d stop making so many if I let myself learn from them!

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Don’t break your back creating a lesson, Morty. It’s a freeform anthology. I’m getting annoyed you’re not hearing that. As you can see around me, your mind’s been blown countless times, and not always by yourself.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Ah, [BLEEP], I don’t even

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : This better not have been a good one. What is this? Great, "Booger AIDS," "AIDS Booger." I gotta start using real file names.In the meantime, enjoy a grab bag of mind blowers I call "Poop AIDS underscore copy."

sp.speaker: Alien King
sp.p: : I’m not an unreasonable man, Beth Smith. I know children are everything to a mammal. I will spare one of their lives. You simply have to choose.

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : Summer! Summer.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : You’re not gonna believe this. I went to Phoebe instead of Titan. It’s, like, hello, Saturn, after ten moons, time to stop naming and start numbering, you know? What’s Wh-What’s with you assholes?

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : Morty, please, don’t do this.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Your Morty is gone! I am Voltamatron, Destroyer of Worlds!

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : Grandpa Rick, there must be some scientific way to save him!

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Not scientific, but there may be a way. Morty, I know you’re in there. It’s me, your grandpa. I know I can be mean, but I love you, Morty. We all do, you gotta fight this thing. I know you can. You’re stronger than all of us!

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : Morty, it’s mom! We love you, you have to fight it!

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : Come on, Morty! Fight that stupid worm thing! We love you! We love you so much! Yes, Morty, come on, you’re doing it! You’re doing it! You’re doing it! Should we pull it out?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : No, don’t touch it. Just keep loving Morty!

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : We still love you. But I do have a thing at 6:00.

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : Oh, God, do I have to keep looking?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Geez, Morty, come on, pinch it off already! Don’t! Oh, God, sorry, Morty, I love you! God, is there going to be an intermission? Excuse me, but I ordered the large evil space worm.I know, it’s like, is that a demon slug in your stomach, or are you just happy to Sorry!

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Well, I guess it’s nice to know the whole family sucks! So if the blues ones are my fault, and the purple ones are my family’s, what are the red ones?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Yeah, d-don’t read into it, Morty!

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Ahh.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : [BLEEP] We need to find shelter before the sunset, Morty. Venzenulon Nine has a night temperature of 300 below! We’ll freeze, Morty! W-We’ll be dead in seconds!

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : I I think I saw a cave over there.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : You’ve seen too many movies, Morty. A cave isn’t gonna cut it. We’re gonna have to use Beebo.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Beebo led us to water! He’s our friend! -

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : He won’t even feel it! -

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Oh, no, no!

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : You wanna die, Morty? Get in Beebo! Oh, no, no! Brace for the ice limit. Here it comes! Wait, are we on Venzenulon Nine or Venzenulon Seven?

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Wait a minute, why would I ask for that to be removed? Are the red ones stuff you wanted removed?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Ooh, that’s clever, Morty, but I don’t use color to sort things because I’m not a mouse in a European children’s book.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Then why are all those pink ones by the liquor?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Liquor? [Bleep], that was close.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : We lost Captain Sky. He gave his life for the uprising.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Yeah. It really makes you think, huh, Morty? We should never take things for granite.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : - What? -

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : I’m just saying, life’s short. We shouldn’t take things for granite.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : - Are you saying "granite"? -

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Well, yeah.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : It’s "granted," with a "D." Take things for granted. Did you actually think it was Jesus Christ, Rick, what are you, a boulder A rock person? How long have you been saying that wrong?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Oh, you like that, huh? I b-b-bet that really blows your mind.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : I mean, yeah, it’s kind of great.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : - You want me to erase it? -

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : What, you can do that?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Ah, [BLEEP].

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : I [BLEEP] knew it, you piece of [BLEEP]! You You You’re a [BLEEP] asshole, Rick!

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Take it easy, Morty, come on. Just relax.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : No, I’m not gonna [BLEEP] relax! Come here!

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Let go of me, you little bitch!

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : I’m gonna grab you by the scruff of your

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Take that!

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Ohh! -

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: Umm.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : - Umm. Uhh.- What -

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : What’s going on? -

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Where am I? -

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Who are we?

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Who am I? I think I’m an adolescent boy.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Huh, and I’m an elderly man. And we appear to be in some kind of secret confined space.Yeah, umm Don’t look at me like that. For all we know, you could be the [BLEEP] weirdo. Huh, these things are obviously storage units, and since we can’t remember what went wrong, my guess is that the technology involves memory, and that this thing on your head is designed to Tell us the code, jagoff! It’s pointless. He’s stonewalling.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Rick, if we don’t unlock those vaccines, Earth dies! You know, it might be time to step up your interrogation!

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Not sure what you’re implying, Morty, but some lines I don’t cross.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Yeah, well, I crossed every line I had when this bastard tried to kill Jessica!

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Okay, see those two fleshy sacs under his chin, Morty? Grab ‘em. You remember the codes now? Twist! Give us the codes, man! Twist harder, Morty! Harder! Okay, let go, let go, let him breathe. He wants to make a deal. Half the codes now, half after you finish.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : But can we trust Wait, what? F-Finish what?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Y-You know

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : I thought I was torturing him!

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Oh, and this disappoints you? Do I tell him we don’t have a deal, Morty? Because if we can kill our enemies, but we can’t jack them off, then how are we better than them?

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Well, what did you find out? We’re partners, I guess, and we fight aliens, like "Men in Black"?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : "Men in Black," "Men in Black." I have "Men in Black 2" in here.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : So So you get the general idea.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Not quite. It’s basically an endless string of callbacks to

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : All right, save it for Youtube.I’ll keep looking for clues.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : What are you doing?

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : You want your shelf level or not?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : And if I say yes, you’re gonna provide that for me with that?

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Yes, see the bubble?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : I’m familiar with the bubble, Morty. I also dabble in precision, and if you think you can even approach it with your sad, naked, caveman eyeball and a bubble of [BLEEP] air, you’re the reason this species is a failure, and it makes me angry!

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : You’re drunk.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : You want to put up a shelf, put up a shelf You want to experience true level? Do you?

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Y-yes.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Ugh, all right, come on.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Wow, it’s so Oh, oh, oh, oh, my God, oh, Christ, ooh, ooh, ooh, ahh.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Oh, yeah, true level, bitch.

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : Morty, come on, we’re leaving for school.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Oh, everything’s crooked! Reality is poison! I want to go back! I hate this!

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : What’s his deal?

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Can’t live like this! Shh, shh, shh, shh, Morty, Morty, Morty.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Go to school, Summer. I’ll go in Morty’s memory and do a little Lambs to the cosmic slaughter!

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Well? You seem to be in charge of what I get to remember. Why?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Good question. Morty, I need darkness to prime these optical inductors. Hit the leftmost light switch by the door for me. The left. Okay, lights on. So, did I just hear three distinct light switch clicks?

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : W-W-What do you mean?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : I feel like the three sounds I heard could be explained by an initial erroneous flipping of a switch on the right followed by a hasty, corrective flipping of the requested switch. Then during the resultant darkness and silence, a third, shameful unflipping of the initially flipped switch. Is my assessment accurate?

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Yeah, that’s that’s basically how how it all shaked out. I’m sorry.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Ugh. All right, come on.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : What?!

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Come on! Grab a shovel.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : W-What is

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Grab a shovel! What was that? I can’t find a goddamn zip tie anywhere! All right, [BLEEP] it! Ahh, zip tie. Why are you making me do this for you again?

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Who doesn’t wish they could talk to animals, Rick?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Most humans! There, I’m done, just stay out of trouble!

sp.speaker: Squirrels
sp.p: : Gotta keep moving. Can’t stop. Up, down, down, up, up, up, down, up, stop, down. The queen needs food. The babies need food. The queen makes babies. The situation in Argentina has proven less convenient than predicted. We’ll have to re-destabilize their economy, refocus labor class outrage from upper to middle, foster a coup, and install a compliant regime. Same as Guatemala? Yes, but you can double time it. We need a quorum to pick a new pope, in case the Exxon/Monsanto thing falls through in Africa. Why not use chemtrails? Put a canopy on Uganda. They’re set to agitate any mo What? That kid is watching us. So, we’re squirrels, he’s a kid. He’s watching us like he hears what we’re saying. Hey, kid. Young man? Come here, little boy. Tell Daphne to run a 199 on a possible Dolittle. Little boy! We’ll give you wishes if you can hear us! We can make you fly and get candy.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Oh, [BLEEP]! Oh, [BLEEP]! [Bleep] me! [Bleep] me! Rick!

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Ah, [BLEEP], Morty, what did you do? All right, Morty, pack your shit! That’s only gonna keep ‘em down for a little bit, Morty! You [BLEEP] with squirrels, Morty! We got a good five minutes before they’re backing up on our ass, Morty! We have to pack up and move to a new reality, Morty! You know I said we could only do that a couple of times! We’re [BLEEP] over here because of these damn squirrels, Morty!

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : I don’t know what my reaction is, but I think I’m mounting in suspicion of you.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : - Well, what are you gonna do? -

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : I’m gonna remember everything! Everything! Yeah! Ow! Ah! Ow!

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Well, what’d you find out? Whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa, what are you gonna do, kill me?

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : No, I’m not gonna kill you. I’m gonna kill myself! All those memories just erased! Sitting in this room collecting dust! W-What’s the point of going on if most of everything that happens just ends up sitting in here?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : All right, kid. I don’t know much aside from the fact that "Men in Black 2" is a joyless cash grab, but I do know that whatever you have brewing around in your noggin really connected with you.I can’t deny that, and I can’t deny that I’m inspired by your passion. I want in Suicide pact! Yes, yeah, let’s do it! Together, you old son of a bitch! On three! One Two

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : You guys doing Morty’s Mind Blowers?

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Morty’s Mind Blowers?

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : Grandpa, is this scenario three?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Uh, w-what’s that, and w-who are you?

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : Oh, man, it’s a scenario four. Ugh, [BLEEP] goddamn it! I don’t get paid enough for this shit!

sp.speaker: TV
sp.p: : There’s a Craftsman nearby. I can smell it.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Whoa, what what

sp.speaker: TV
sp.p: : Can I help you?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : H-How did we fall asleep during interdimensional cable? -

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Yeah, what the hell, Summer? -

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Summer, you dumb bitch! How long were we out, you dumb bitch! How much interdimensional cable did we miss, you stupid bitch! How many improv TV shows with commercials did we miss, Summer? Why did you let us fall asleep? You dumb bitch! You stupid bitch! All right, Morty, [BLEEP] this noise.Let’s get out of here and go on a classic Rick and Morty adventure.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Yeah, right, Rick, I’m allin.

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : No wonder you’re constantly fighting with each other and behind schedule.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : What?

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : Nothing.

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: : Rick? Hello? Just here for my putter. Jerry’s Mind Blowers?

sp.speaker: Helicopter Passenger
sp.p: : Follow the boys! We’re charged and aimed at Alpha Centauri, ready for transport. They fell for it! Let’s send Gobo home! All right! -

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : Where’s dad? -

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : He should be here any second.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : It’s funny, Jerry spent his life seeking attention, but in the end, humanity’s instinctive dismissal of him saved an alien’s life.

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : He knows where to go, right?

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Yep, any minute now.

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: : Did it work? Did you guys get Gobo home?

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : You have Gobo! You were supposed to bring him to the hill!

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: : As if. He was in your basket.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : He was in your car! Oh! Oof! Dibs on his stuff. Did yoof that?
